description:
**Fix Overview**:

To mitigate the Microsoft OpenSSH for Windows remote code execution vulnerability (CVE-2024-43581), it is critical to apply the following updates:

1. Identify the version of Windows installed on your system from the list of build numbers to determine the appropriate KB articles.

2. Download the necessary updates for your Windows version:
   - For Windows 11 Version 24H2 (x64): [KB5044284](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5044284)
   - For Windows 11 Version 23H2 (x64): [KB5044285](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5044285)
   - For Windows 11 Version 22H2 (x64): [KB5044280](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5044280)
   - For Windows 11 Version 21H2 (x64): [KB5044280](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5044280)
   - For Windows 10 Version 22H2 (x64): [KB5044273](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5044273)
   - For Windows 10 Version 21H2 (x64): [KB5044273](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5044273)

3. Install the downloaded updates and restart your system to ensure all changes take effect.

**Details**:
- This update addresses vulnerabilities related to external control of file name or path, enhancing system security against potential exploitation. 
- Ensure the system is updated to the specified build numbers and has administrative privileges to perform the installation.
